Job description:
Why Pure

We’re here with the humble aspiration to accelerate the speed of human progress with our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology. We’re driven by our belief that storage isn’t just a place to put things, it’s a powerful force to be unleashed - a force that will remove the limitations on those building the world of today, so they can erase the word “impossible” from tomorrow.  Our all-flash storage solutions offer radically simple technology to help companies unlock their future possibilities, today.

Our founders created the company with a passion to build storage technology customers love and deliver it with simplicity and service that fundamentally changes the enterprise storage experience. Founded in 2009, our record revenue growth has landed us among a very select group of companies. Today, customers and industries across the world are experiencing the benefits of going Pure - from Barclays to Linkedin.com and ConocoPhillips, Pure adopters cover a broad spectrum from global consumer brands, to healthcare, education and finance. 

Our Team

Puritans come from various backgrounds and we thrive off of challenging the norm. This cross pollination of backgrounds led to numerous ground breaking ideas and has helped us build one of the most reliable and easy to use storage systems in the industry. ?We strive to hire the best and brightest people, who excel in a cutting edge, fast paced, collaborative and transparent environment.  We are seeking enthusiastic individuals to solve real world problems while having fun along the way.

What You Will Be Doing

This role requires a combination of skills with Virtual environments, working with some of the most exciting, challenging and large-scale systems in Europe to drive the innovation and efficiency agenda with both existing and new customers. This includes acting as a trusted advisor to customers in use of best practices, scaling, tuning and troubleshooting of all things virtual, as well as providing guidance and feedback to Pure engineering and global product teams on future enhancements of our technology to help drive even larger gains in the technology. The second key aspect of the role is in engagement with the wider 'V' user community to build Pure’s capability and help shape the future direction of our product line with a hugely diverse user base from hedge funds to oil exploration to F1 racing teams. This also involves travelling to conferences, expos etc to present and represent Pure where there is interest from a particular technology vertical.

  • Be a Virtualisation Subject Matter Expert for Pure EMEA
  • Build the Pure brand in the product vertical through a range of channels
  • Enhance the Pure technology stack to improve efficiency, performance, agility with the product
  • Work closely with PM, Marketing, Engineering, CSG and global SA team to build the product capability with Pure technology
  • Train internal SE community (incl. partners) to enhance their skills and knowledge with the product - the ‘why Pure’ message
  • Present the Pure capability at industry vertical and product specific events
  • Build (or enhance) social media presence to increase Pure mindshare with the product user base
  • Create written collateral to build a repository of high quality research and consumer material for Pure with the product

What You Bring To The Team

  • In-depth product experience from a user perspective, ideally at enterprise scale
  • Strong consultancy/soft skills for customer engagements, 1:1 and 1:many presentations, creation of high-quality written documentation and presentation material; blog presence a plus rather than a requirement
  • Troubleshooting, diagnosis, automation, performance analysis of the product vertical

  • Multi-lingual in European or Eastern languages a strong plus

Culture & Perks

Pure is a very special place. What makes and keeps us special is who we recruit to join us and how we work together. Our culture was shaped organically as our early team poured their heart and soul into Pure’s first generation product and supporting our early customers and partners.  We expect each employee to approach their job at Pure with the same level of pride and care, and perpetuate the values that are making us the best storage company in history.

At the center of those values is the belief that the single most important thing we do is continue to hire the best and create a workplace where they thrive and enjoy. To reward our employees for the great work they’re doing we offer a number of perks and benefits.

Job description:
Use your specialized knowledge and program management skills to end educational inequality! 

TNTP seeks a full-time Benefits and Compensation Manager to join our Talent & Culture department.  This position can be based from a home office anywhere in the United States or from the TNTP central office in Brooklyn.  This is a Program Manager-level position and requires travel a few times each year for team meetings and retreats, as well as one organization-wide conference a year.   

Who We Are

TNTP is a national nonprofit founded by teachers that believes our nation’s public schools can offer all children an excellent education. Today we’re a diverse team from a wide range of fields, united by a fierce commitment to helping school systems end educational inequality and achieve their goals for students. We work at every level of the public education system to attract and train talented teachers and school leaders, ensure rigorous and engaging classrooms, and create environments that prioritize great teaching and accelerate student learning. 

The Total Rewards team, part of our Talent & Culture (HR) department works to ensure that TNTP can find, grow, and keep amazing people (currently a national staff of more than 350 full and part-time staff) through offering a highly attractive compensation and benefits package.

What You’ll Do

Reporting into the Director of Total Rewards, we expect the Benefits and Compensation Manager to meet the following goals:

  • Provide excellent communication and customer service to TNTP employees related to their benefits and compensation
  • Support the financial sustainability of TNTP’s benefits program through effective management of benefits vendors, clear employee communications, and efficient processes.
  • Provide data to support TNTP decision-makers on matters related to benefits and compensation 
  • Ensure full compliance with federal, state, and local regulations related to benefits and wage/hour requirements.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Data analysis – Build reports and conduct data analysis for the purposes of monitoring and decision-making for annual benefits renewal strategy, annual compensation model matrix setting, quarterly meetings of TNTP’s investment committee, and routine compliance and quality control processes. Participate in annual compensation surveys and extract benchmark data from salary surveys.
  • Vendor management – Manage contracts, invoices, and communications with TNTP’s benefits providers.
  • Employee issue resolution – In collaboration with TNTP’s benefits broker and benefits providers, successfully resolve employee benefits issues.
  • Project management – Develop and maintain project plans for benefits and compensation activities.
  • Employee communications – Develop and disseminate routine employee-facing communications regarding compensation and benefits.
  • Compliance – Implement processes and activities required of TNTP for compliance with regulations regarding benefits and wage/hour topics.

What You Bring

We are looking for amazing people who have diverse backgrounds and experiences, are inspired by our mission and are highly motivated to change children’s lives through education. You’ll be right at home here if you learn from failure and overcome adversity, cultivate strong relationships, and push yourself, your work and the people around you to the next level. 

We expect the Benefits and Compensation Manager to:

  • Embrace a fast-moving organization. Deadlines, changing priorities and new projects don’t overwhelm you. Instead, they inspire you to rise to the occasion. 
  • Plan and execute smooth operations. Your planning will be the backbone of an efficient and productive team. The team will look to you to establish systems, develop project plans, and support implementation.
  • Deliver crisp, clean messages. Whether in writing or on the phone, your communications are articulate and concise. You understand your audience and know how to deliver inspiring messages and tough news with ease and tactful finesse.
  • Love Data.  Your inclination to analyze data and make it come alive will be crucial in informing the work of the team.  
  • Partner with education leaders. You’ll regularly interact with clients, building strong relationships and providing a high level of support.  

Qualifications

  • Two plus years in HR administration, preferably in the area of compensation and/or benefits
  • Knowledge of benefits/wage and hour regulations (PPACA, ERISA, COBRA, HIPAA, FLSA)
  • Three plus years of program/project management experience with extraordinary attention to detail and professionalism
  • The ability to execute multiple programs simultaneously
  • Strong writing skills for formal and informal communications
  • Intermediate expertise with descriptive data analysis in Excel required and familiarity with a data visualization tool such as Tableau or analysis software like R a major plus 
  • Professional certification in benefits and/or compensation (CEBS, CCP) a plus 
  • Outstanding interpersonal, communication and teamwork skills, including the ability to collaborate, attain and grow effective partnerships to meet common goals
  • Flexibility and comfort with ambiguity

What We Offer

TNTP offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience in a similar position with the potential for an annual performance based bonus. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan, covering the majority of the employee premium for the base medical plan and subsidizing the majority of costs for a spouse/domestic partner and children. Other benefits include dental and vision plans, disability, life insurance, parenting benefits, flexible spending account options, generous vacation time, commuter benefits, referral bonuses, professional development, and a 403(b) plan with employer matching. We also offer an inclusive environment where staff are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work every day. TNTP may offer a relocation stipend to defray the cost of moving for this role, if applicable.  

To Apply

Please submit your resume and tailored cover letter online at http://bit.ly/2b4uY6k. 

It’s in your best interest to apply as soon as possible. We recommend including a cover letter in your application addressing why you are interested in TNTP and how your experience has prepared you for this position. Please note that an offer of employment will be subject to the successful completion of a background check. 

At TNTP, we believe that diversity makes us stronger and challenges us to think differently every day. TNTP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status or disability.

DigitalOcean is on a mission to simplify cloud infrastructure for the millions of software developers around the world. We are a small, distributed, and cohesive team. At DigitalOcean, every single engineer has a massive impact on the organization and product, and we want to keep it that way. We believe in autonomy for teams and individuals.

Are you passionate about Distributed Systems at scale?

As a Senior Software Engineer on the Compute team, the software you write will run on tens of thousands of hypervisors across our global infrastructure. You will define the next generation of cloud services, making developers' lives (both inside DO and in the 'wild') easier by building new services that improve our efficiency and also provide important new features for our customers. If your passion is Distributed Systems, this is the right job for you.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Build the services that build Droplets (our customer’s VM instances)
  • Design, implement, test and optimize new services that run at scale and solve challenging distributed coordination problems.
  • Work with our product teams to build the next generation of products and services for our developers community.

What We'll Expect From You:

  • 7+ years of experience with distributed systems programming
  • Significant experience as a software engineer, developer, or programmer building software used by 100s, if not 1000s of users
  • Expertise with at least one of the following languages: Go, Perl, Ruby, Python, C/C++, Java
  • Experience with at least one configuration management system like Chef, Ansible and/or Puppet.
  • Experience with technologies like Kafka, RabbitMQ, GRPC, Consul is a plus.
  • Strong opinions, weakly held

Technologies We Use:

  • Kafka, RabbitMQ, Consul, Go, Perl, gRPC, MySQL, Chef, Ansible, Git

Why You’ll Like Working for DigitalOcean: 

  • Because we have amazing people. We can promise you will work with some of the smartest and coolest people in the industry. We work hard but we always have fun doing it. Archery classes, DJ lessons, and office pie fights are a thing. We care deeply about each other and take our “no jerks” rule very seriously.
  • Because we value development. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.  You’ll need to be great to get hired here and we promise you’ll get even better.
  • Because we care about you. We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to keep you fit, and a monthly commute allowance to make your trips to and from work easier.
  • Because we invest in your future. We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match. We also provide all employees with Kindles and reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
  • Because we want you to love where you work. We have a great office space located in the heart of SoHo NYC and offer daily catered lunches to keep your hunger at bay. We’re also very remote-friendly—we use Slack to communicate across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to take an all-expense-paid trip to our HQ to get quality in-person time with the team at least once a year. We also allow employees to customize their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in HQ.
  • Because we value diversity and inclusivity. We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

TNTP seeks a full-time IT Manager for the Technology Services Department. This position can be based from a home office anywhere in the country or from TNTP’s offices in Brooklyn, NY. This position is available immediately.  Time in TNTP's Brooklyn office monthly is required, as well as approximately 20% travel each year.   

Who We Are

TNTP is a national nonprofit founded by teachers that believes our nation’s public schools can offer all children an excellent education. Today we’re a diverse team from a wide range of fields, united by a fierce commitment to helping school systems end educational inequality and achieve their goals for students. TNTP’s Technology Services Department supports our organization with internal and client-facing technology needs. Our team is virtual, with some of us based in TNTP’s Brooklyn office, and the rest working remotely from home offices across the country. 

What You’ll Do

The IT Manager will manage TNTP’s help desk team to ensure TNTP has the technology infrastructure, hardware and software the organization needs to ensure we can reach our goals for students. 

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Manage TNTP’s technology infrastructure, including:

    • Ensure the security, reliability, stability, and connectivity of computer systems and network infrastructure to ensure stable operations;

What You Bring

We are looking for amazing people who have diverse backgrounds and experiences, are inspired by our mission and are highly motivated to change children’s lives through education. You’ll be right at home here if you learn from failure and overcome adversity, cultivate strong relationships, and push yourself, your work and the people around you to the next level. 

We expect our IT Manager to:

  • Be an outstanding technologist: You have experience handling performance issues in a Microsoft Windows environment and can effectively manage an Enterprise level of the Office 365 Platform and Microsoft Active Directory (required).  Your background includes working with networks and cloud infrastructure services.
  • Solve practical problems: You have an ability to solve problems and deal with a variety of changing variables in situations where limited standardization exists.Troubleshooting issues with a distributed workforce, including home-office environments preferred. 
  • Communicate complex information to a variety of audiences: We are counting on your ability to present information to and respond to questions from both business stakeholders and vendors. 

Qualifications

  • At least 3 years managing Help Desk and Infrastructure teams
  • Deep experience with automating the creation, updating and deployment of machine images
  • Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory (Domains, Group Policies, Security Groups, etc.) 
  • Strong network troubleshooting skills (IP, Switch, Cabling, etc.)
  • Several years of Windows Server 2008/2012 based systems management and administration
  • Excellent abilities with entire Office 2013/2016 suite of applications;
  • Familiarity with VOIP telephony and mobile device support
  • Understanding of Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure
  • Track record of managing external vendors and negotiations of their contracts
  • Comfortable handling multiple projects and timelines simultaneously 
  • Self-motivation and insatiable hunger to learn
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret cross functional documentation and procedures
  • Documentation experience to include writing reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals
  • Ability to track and trend problems and identify solutions
  • Experience with Kaseya line of support products (preferred)
  • Experience with SharePoint (preferred)
  • Experience with selecting and implementing ticketing systems (preferred)

Counsyl seeks to hire a ABGC-certified genetic counselor as Medical Science Liaisons supporting our Oncology division. One field-based position is available on the West Coast (e.g., San Francisco, Los Angeles, Seattle). Other geographic locations within this region will be considered.


What you'll do

  • Deliver Counsyl’s mission of accessible genetic screening to health care providers in oncology and oncology genetics, in addition to large organizations, such as hospital systems
  • Collaborate with sales, marketing, and clinical staff at Counsyl to deepen knowledge and understanding of the oncology genetics landscape (for example, clinical training of the sales team, translating new literature for incorporation into messaging)
  • Assist in efforts to gain professional support for Counsyl via, for example, medical conferences and networking with key influencers
  • Contribute cross-departmentally on efforts related to inherited cancer screening products

About you

  • ABGC-certified Genetic Counselor with clinical experience and credibility in oncology
  • Impactful speaker in small and large group settings, as well as an effective writer
  • Experience in strategic thinking roles and/or commercial organizations preferred
  • Able to travel (50% or higher, dependent on your home location)
  • Adept with Internet and mobile technology

Counsyl is a health technology company that offers DNA screening for diseases that can impact men, women and their children. The Counsyl philosophy is simple: screen for diseases where advanced knowledge makes a difference in health outcomes, whether it’s changing a behavior, pursuing preventative measures, or simply preparing for what lies ahead. The Counsyl team includes an accomplished group of problem-solvers — top engineers, scientists, and designers — who are taking the lead on building the modern clinical laboratory. Scientific rigor, custom robotics, and software are at the heart of every Counsyl product, resulting in better, faster and more affordable screens that are broadly accessible. Beyond the laboratory, Counsyl offers doctors and patients a technology platform for results delivery in real time, with on-demand access to board-certified genetic counselors. Counsyl has screened more than 600,000 patients and served more than 6,000 health care professionals in its CLIA-certified, CAP-accredited and NYS CLEP-permitted clinical laboratory. The company has raised a total of $102 million and is privately backed by RSTP, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Founders Fund, Felicis Ventures, David Drummond, and other high profile investors.

Job description:
The genetic counseling team at Counsyl helps thousands of patients a year understand the results of their Counsyl screening results.  We provide scheduled consults and on-demand consults by phone for all three products (Family Prep, Informed Pregnancy and Inherited Cancer).  

What you'll do

  • Help patients make sense of the results of high throughput genomics
  • Perform phone-based genetic counseling sessions for our on-demand and scheduled consult service from a home-based office
  • Document consults in professionally written consult summaries
  • Apply for and maintain licensure in all required States

About you

  • You are an ABGC-certified genetic counselor with greater than 5 years clinical experience in cancer and reproductive genetics
  • Computer savvy: Though not a programmer, you have above average IT skills
  • You are that rare kind of person who has a way with both people and probabilities
  • You can self-motivate and work well independently
  • You are passionate about Counsyl’s mission

Counsyl is a health technology company that offers DNA screening for diseases that can impact men, women and their children. The Counsyl philosophy is simple: screen for diseases where advanced knowledge makes a difference in health outcomes, whether it’s changing a behavior, pursuing preventative measures, or simply preparing for what lies ahead.

The Counsyl team includes an accomplished group of problem-solvers — top engineers, scientists, and designers — who are taking the lead on building the modern clinical laboratory. Scientific rigor, custom robotics, and software are at the heart of every Counsyl product, resulting in better, faster and more affordable screens that are broadly accessible. Beyond the laboratory, Counsyl offers doctors and patients a technology platform for results delivery in real time, with on-demand access to board-certified genetic counselors.

Counsyl has screened more than 500,000 patients and served more than 6,000 health care professionals in its CLIA-certified, CAP-accredited and NYS CLEP-permitted clinical laboratory. The company has raised a total of $102 million and is privately backed by RSTP, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Founders Fund, Felicis Ventures, David Drummond, and other high profile investors.

Product Knowledge

Every month you receive a group of blog posts to edit and provide peer feedback to your fellow Style Advisors

Job description:
Seeking an outstanding writer to tell stories from the classroom.

TNTP seeks a full-time Communications Manager – Publications for our Communications & Publications Department. This position can be based in a home office anywhere in the U.S. or from the TNTP central office in Brooklyn, NY.

Who We Are

TNTP is a national nonprofit founded by teachers that believes our nation’s public schools can offer all children an excellent education. Today we’re a diverse team from a wide range of fields, united by a fierce commitment to helping school systems end educational inequality and achieve their goals for students. We work at every level of the public education system to attract and train talented teachers and school leaders, ensure rigorous and engaging classrooms, and create environments that prioritize great teaching and accelerate student learning.

Our Communications & Publications Department works to position TNTP as the nation’s most authoritative voice on effective teachers. The department is responsible for TNTP's communications, public relations, and marketing efforts – including publishing TNTP’s influential blog and nationally acclaimed research and policy papers, such as The Mirage (2015), The Irreplaceables (2012) and The Widget Effect (2009), and Room to Run (2016), TNTP’s first multimedia feature. In addition to the TNTP Blog, reports and papers, TNTP’s publications strategy includes a strong social media element.

Who We Want

We are looking for amazing people who have diverse backgrounds and experiences, are inspired by our mission and are highly motivated to change children’s lives through education. If you’ve been pegged as a problem solver, have a strong eye for detail, and proven you thrive in a fast-paced environment, you’ll be right at home here. We’re looking for talented people who learn from failure and overcome adversity, cultivate strong relationships, and push themselves, their work and the people around them to the next level.

As Communications Manager – Publications, you will work closely with staff across the Communications & Publications department to plan, write, edit and design publications and the TNTP Blog in a way that meets TNTP’s extremely high standards. You will support releases and help identify and develop new publications opportunities, but will be most closely focused on collaborating with other TNTP staff to write content that will effectively engage a wide range of audiences, from teachers to educational leaders to government officials and community members.

We expect our Communications Manager – Publications to:

  • Be an amazing writer. You are able to write and edit content, often on a tight timeline, that appeals to readers, advances arguments, and inspires action. You have proven experience in a communications-related position and excel at distilling complex content into simple, clear prose. You also understand the value of visual elements in telling a story.
  • Connect the dots. You’ll use your problem-solving skills to propose ideas for blog posts and new publications—and then you’ll make those ideas happen. Ambiguity doesn’t bother you; just the opposite, you thrive on it. Your creative instincts and strategic skills will help you deal with vague situations and develop new approaches with limited guidance.
  • Adeptly manage complex projects and people. You have a strong ability to build relationships and manage projects involving multiple people. You’ll be expected to influence and coordinate a wide range of TNTP staff and leadership team members who play an important role in developing and reviewing publications and the TNTP Blog. You’re able to work well with anyone.
  • Embrace a fast-moving organization. Deadlines, changing priorities and new projects don’t scare you. Instead, they inspire you to rise to the occasion.

What You'll Do

The Communications Manager - Publications will:

  • Write and edit outstanding content that maintains TNTP’s high standards for substance and style. Content includes, but is not limited to, blog posts, reports, op-eds, talking points and messages for staff, concepts for infographics, and social media content.
  • Support the execution of TNTP’s publications strategy, aligning with internal organizational priorities and goals and positioning TNTP as an authoritative voice on issues that transform the teaching profession. You will have a particular focus on the TNTP Blog.
  • Lead the execution of multi-part blog series, which may include planning and sourcing content, conducting interviews in person or over the phone, coordinating with contractors (such as photographers and audio editors), and thinking about how to tell a cohesive story over time using multiple forms of media.
  • Provide additional writing support to the Communications & Publications team as necessary.
  • Anticipate and help ensure the team meets TNTP staff needs for client resources related to TNTP publications.
  • Support TNTP staff in making and acting on strong connections between publications and opportunities for TNTP to develop new work and services.

What We Offer

TNTP offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience in a similar position with the potential for an annual performance-based bonus. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan effective on the first day of employment. We pay 100% of employee-only medical coverage and subsidize the majority of costs for a spouse/domestic partner and children. Other benefits include dental and vision plans, disability, life insurance, parenting benefits, flexible spending account options, generous vacation time, commuter benefits, referral bonuses, professional development, and a 403(b) plan with employer matching. We also offer an inclusive environment where staff are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work each day. TNTP may also offer a relocation stipend to help defray the cost of moving for this role, if applicable.

To Apply

Please submit your resume and tailored cover letter online.

We review applications on a rolling basis – so it is to your advantage to apply as soon as possible. We will not consider applications without a cover letter tailored to this position, which can be addressed to the Human Capital department. Please note that an offer of employment will be subject to the successful completion of a background check. At TNTP, we know that diversity makes us stronger and challenges us to think differently every day. We are an equal opportunity employer and seek individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds to apply to this position.

  • Life at TNTP: http://tntp.org/join/life-at-tntp

DESCRIPTION

TNTP is hiring a full time Business Analyst to join our Technology Services team. This position is available immediately, will be based in our Brooklyn central office or from a home office anywhere in the United States, and will require occasional travel

Who We Are

TNTP is a national nonprofit founded by teachers that believes our nation’s public schools can offer all children an excellent education. Today we’re a diverse team from a wide range of fields, united by a fierce commitment to helping school systems end educational inequality and achieve their goals for students. We work at every level of the public education system to attract and train talented teachers and school leaders, ensure rigorous and engaging classrooms, and create environments that prioritize great teaching and accelerate student learning.

TNTP’s Technology Services Department supports our organization with internal and client-facing technology needs. Our team is virtual, with some of us based in TNTP’s Brooklyn office, and the rest working remotely from home offices across the country.  

With an annual operating budget of over $60 million, TNTP’s business model is based primarily on fee for service client engagements with large, urban school districts, state departments of education and charter schools working to ensure all students get an outstanding education, no matter where they live. The Business Analyst, as a member of the Technology Services team, supports the operational processes, systems (primarily Salesforce), reporting and analytics for business development at TNTP. This includes managing an evolving process based on TNTP’s implementation of Salesforce.com.

What You'll Do

The Business Analyst, will work collaboratively with internal groups to maintain and support TNTP’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system, Salesforce.com., and analyze process and technology challenges and recommend practical solutions. The Analyst provides key analytics that support our business development strategy. As an Analyst, you will keep a constant pulse on systems and data trends to ensure the Legal and Business Development Operations team meets their goals and drives business development strategy for the organization.  Over time, you will also have the opportunity to work collaboratively with internal and external clients to analyze process and technology challenges and recommend practical solutions.

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Provide expert technical leadership on the management and use of Salesforce.com
  • Ensure that Salesforce is effectively developed, maintained and supported to enable the organization to meet its business needs 
  • Design and generate statistical summary and analytical reports, including financial reports
  • Support data integrity and reporting that effectively supports TNTP business partners.  
  • Provide guidance, training and support to Salesforce end users

What You Bring
We are looking for a creative problem solver who loves technology, knows how to build strong relationships with clients in order to diagnose their needs and implement effective solutions, and enjoys constantly learning and innovating.  We are looking for amazing people who have diverse backgrounds and experiences, are inspired by our mission and are highly motivated to change children’s lives through education. You’ll be right at home here if you learn from failure and overcome adversity, cultivate strong relationships, and push yourself, your work and the people around you to the next level (a sense of humor and passion for good food are welcome too). 

We expect our Business Analyst to:

  • Manage and improve on systems. You’ll use your familiarity with CRM systems, technical, analytical and problem solving skills to propose solutions and run with them every day.
  • Love Data. Your experience analyzing data and making it come alive will be crucial.  You will design and implement processes and reports to ensure data integrity.
  • Generate Solutions. You’ll use your creative problem solving skills to address complex problems that will best support internal group needs.
  • Connect the dots. You’ll use your strong project management and problem solving skills to create and execute on multiple, complex streams of work, proposing solutions to thorny issues and making critical decisions on the best course of action for our work.  Ambiguity doesn’t scare you; just the opposite, you thrive on it. 
  • Partner with TNTP staff. You’ll regularly interact with staff who use Salesforce and will approach solving problems with their perspectives in mind, providing resources, recommending solutions and motivating them to try out new ways of working. 
  • Embrace a fast-moving organization. Deadlines, changing priorities and new projects don’t overwhelm you. Instead, they inspire you to rise to the occasion.
  • Deliver crisp, clean messages. Whether in writing or on the phone, your communications are articulate and concise. You understand your audience and know how to deliver inspiring messages and tough news with ease and tactful finesse.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Salesforce.com administration experience (required) Salesforce Administration certification (preferred).
  • 3+ years of experience working in an Analyst function
  • The ability to critically assess challenges and identify flexible, effective solutions in ambiguous situations
  • Strong client management and relationship building skills
  • Excellent project management skills, including the ability to work independently and efficiently towards goals in a virtual, fast-paced environment and manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, including the ability to identify challenges and proactively generate creative solutions
  • Ability to communicate well, facilitate discussion, lead trainings, resolve problems, and understand the needs and desires of end-users 
  • Ability to research, assess, and recommend improvements to business processes, organization, and policies that can increase the advantages gained from technical and non-technical solutions 
  • Strong analytical skills and proven experience using data to drive decision-making
  • Experience writing user-stories, business requirements, functional specifications, and developing process diagrams

What We Offer
TNTP offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience in a similar position with the potential for an annual performance based bonus. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan, covering the majority of the employee premium for the base medical plan and subsidizing the majority of costs for a spouse/domestic partner and children. Other benefits include dental and vision plans, disability, life insurance, parenting benefits, flexible spending account options, generous vacation time, commuter benefits, referral bonuses, professional development, and a 403(b) plan with employer matching. We also offer an inclusive environment where staff are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work every day. TNTP may offer a relocation stipend to defray the cost of moving for this role, if applicable.  

To Apply
Please submit your resume and tailored cover letter online.  

It’s in your best interest to apply as soon as possible. We recommend including a cover letter in your application addressing why you are interested in TNTP and how your experience has prepared you for this position. Please note that an offer of employment will be subject to the successful completion of a background check.
